alert.note: Alert for Aurora; Bon Homme; Davison; Douglas; Hutchinson; Jerauld (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 04 at 2:15PM MDT until April 04 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHEASTERN SOUTH DAKOTA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHEASTERN SOUTH DAKOTA... The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 9 PM CDT this evening. A Red Flag Warning has also been issued from noon to 9 PM CDT Tuesday. * AFFECTED AREA...In South Dakota...Fire weather zone 050 Gregory, fire weather zone 057 Brule, and fire weather zone 063 Charles Mix. * WIND...For today, southerly sustained winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. For Tuesday, west to northwesterly sustained winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts 30 to 45 mph. * HUMIDITY...Lowest relative humidity of 15 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Aurora; Bon Homme; Davison; Douglas; Hutchinson; Jerauld
